title: My client's email signature reads: '- Sent from phone, please excuse any typo's -'. ​Should I point out to him that this, in fact, is a typo? - Quora

response.answer_text: Being that he/she is a client of yours, plus the fact that the person has handily stated for it to be ignored, I would just let that be... Unless you're really chummy with the person and you pointing it out would be harmless. Say you do point it out; On a good day, the person acknowledges and may or may not change it (could be a tongue in cheek thing or inside joke) -BUT- on a bad day, maybe the person takes offense and you find yourself minus one client.
